John McCain: McCain does not allow his staffers to hold positions as lobbyists.[67]
Barack Obama: Obama does not take contributions from federally registered lobbyists or PACs, though he does accept money from non-federal lobbyists and unregistered lobbyists.[67]

column4: At the beginning of his campaign, Nader stated that he "will receive no money from commercial interests, no money from political action committees, only from individuals."[41] He sees Washington D.C. as "corporate-occupied territory, every department agency controlled by overwhelming presence of corporate lobbyists, corporate executives in high government positions."[41] He supports public financing of campaigns and free TV and radio time for ballot qualified candidates.[68]
